Key Match Events: Alex Carey and Mitchell Starc’s return to go 2-0 up in the five-match series
Ben Duckett was flummoxed by a slower ball from Aaron Hardie, who leapt to his left in his follow-through to pick up a toe-ended pull like a parent stretching to scoop up a toddler’s beaker
Will Jacks was caught by a diving Alex Carey with a legside flick that he’d like to forget first ball
Jamie Smith and Jacob Bethell put on a careful 55
Adil Rashid, promoted up the order, was off the mark with a boundary
Pre-Game Insights: England had looked in with a good shot at the halfway stage after they dismissed Australia within 45 overs
Phil Salt’s short but eventful innings included three flamed fours, a survived review off Hazlewood, a drop at slip by a lunging Matt Short
Harry Brook was off the mark through midwicket with a typically sharp clip to the rope from Starc, to roared appreciation for the local lad
Post-Match Reflections: Brook was phlegmatic afterwards, saying 'We’re an inexperienced team playing against one of the best sides in the world – it’s about patience, we’re only two games in.'

Carey said 'Not much has to change for everything to change' and 'They [England] are still a highly skilled bunch of players, but that’s one-day cricket, your momentum is key, at the moment we’ve got the momentum.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Glenn Maxwell, Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc’s return to the team
Harry Brook’s team stumbled to their second loss in a row
A sell-out crowd roasting in the unexpected September heat on the Western Terrace’s open seats
